msIdentifier.repository: The Heritage Center of The Union League of Philadelphia
msIdentifier.collection: The Civil War Museum of Philadelphia Collection, General Manuscript Collection

msContents.summary: John N. Parker pocket diary, September 1861-August 1862, while serving as a Sergeant with the 4th Regiment Rhode Island Infantry. The diary documents Burnside's expedition to Hatteras Inlet and Roanoke Island in North Carolina (January 7-February 8, 1862), the Battle of Roanoke Island (February 9, 1862), the Battle of New Berne (March 14, 1862), and the siege, bombardment, and capture of Fort Macon (March 23-April 26, 1862).

msItem.title: New York, New York; Washington, D.C.

supportDesc.extent: 226; page dimensions: 120 x 78; bound to: 122 x 80

keywords.term: New Bern, Battle of, New Bern, N.C., 1862
United States. Army. Rhode Island Infantry Regiment, 4th (1861-1864)
